result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Hessler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse County Clerk of Courts

miscConds.notes:
The defendant is currently in Hazelton Aftercare Program - he is to continue with that and successfully complete the program
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician
.

Follow-through with any treatment the PO deems appropriate

Def is to be subjected to any Mediation or Reconciliation services requested by the victims through the PO.  The DA's office is to make contact with the victims advising them of the PO assigned to the defendant and provide them with contact info of the PO to allow each victim to have access to the PO to arrange what they feel they need in order to go forward in this case

The defendant is to pay for any Mediation / Reconciliation sessions that the Court has made available to the victims - they will be the defendant's responsibility

The def is to be subjected to any other conditions deemed appropriate by the PO

Pay Restitution of $209.95 to Gregory B., $690 to LeeAnne & Jason D., $339.79 to Margaret H., $325 to Amy & Michael J., $734.60 to Diane K., $698.24 to Mary & Larry M., $3,114.20 to Julie & Gordon N., & $150 to Della S

Pay 10% restitution surcharge to the DA's office

Restitution is to be paid to victims first before surcharge to the DA's office

Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of Gross Wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

Credit for 21 days if probation is ever revoked

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt
